results.title: The Importance of making notes
results.brief_description: Discusses the important skills of note-taking, showing how to take good notes in oral instruction periods and during reading. Explains how to determine the key ideas for notes; describes the kinds of information which should be taken down verbatim, and points out when notes should not be taken at all.

results.title: The Importance of keeping perfectly still
results.creator_credit: Kookaburra Productions, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Mark Ruse and Michael Pattinson
results.brief_description: Concerns a young man apprenticed to a high society photographer at the turn of the 19th century. When his boss receives a vice regal appointment to photograph the Governor’s family, he cannot handle the strain of this and a love affair at the same time. His girlfriend insists that she must have a ‘sign’ from heaven before a marriage can take place. Cast includes Liddy Clark, Frederick Parslow, Peter Sardi, Frank Thring, Frank Wilson.

results.title: The Importance of food safety
results.brief_description: This video is about how to safely handle and prepare food for public consumption. It is aimed at people who prepare food in the hospitality industry and other food handling professions, but contains useful tips to keep in mind when preparing food in the home. Discusses bacteria and how to lessen its effects, storage temperatures and conditions for food, both raw and cooked, freezing, thawing and cooking of food, delivery of food and how to lessen the likelihood of illness from improperly prepared food. Includes a questionnaire to test knowledge of content of video.

results.title: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation
results.brief_description: Shows how the three aims of controlled irrigation can be achieved in furrow irrigation by putting the “correct flow” down the furrows so as to obtain even distribution of the water over the whole area and down to the depth of the root zone. The various factors which determine “correct flow” are briefly considered and finally the method whereby it may be obtained and checked is outlined.

results.title: The Importance of being earnest [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Javelin, Two Cities Films, Teddy Baird and Anthony Asquith
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s brilliant play “The Importance of being earnest” (1895), adapted and directed for the screen by Anthony Asquith, is probably the best-known comedy of manners in the world. Jack Worthing and Algernon Moncrieff are friends, both bachelors operating in English society hoping to find love in a proper match. Each man has spun lies about a fake identity in order to achieve romance with Gwendolyn Fairfax and Cecily Cardew, respectively. When the two couples meet up at Cecily’s place of residence, their lies unfurl and the true selves of both are revealed. Wilde’s last play is a satire on English society and manners, wonderfully sending up the portentousness and pomposity of the upper classes. Two particularly memorable characters are the boorish snob Lady Bracknell and the dithering governess Miss Prism (the latter played with import here by Margaret Rutherford). Asquith never quite transcends the script’s theatrical origins, but does successfully recreate the cadence and spirit of Wilde’s sardonic, barbed wit.

results.title: The Importance of a good figure
results.brief_description: After an introduction to the computer, the film uses the processing of a railwayman’s pay to bring home the need for accuracy of computer input. Animation explains the technique which the computer uses to process staff pay. Examples of the wide use of computers show how more and more people are becoming involved with this need for accuracy.

results.title: The Impersonation
results.brief_description: Since it first became known in 1974, the signature of the contemporary English ‘primitive’ painter, Reginald Pepper, has been gaining prominence amongst critics and collectors. It now appears that such a painter does not exist. This film presents an overview of the case of Reginald Pepper and also looks at the broader issues concerning ‘primitivism’ in art.

results.title: The Immortal story
results.creator_credit: Albina Productions, Office de Radiodiffusion Television Francais, Micheline Rozan and Orson Welles
results.brief_description: Orson Welles stars and directs (as he so often does, and does well) in this adaptation of Isak Dinesen’s (Karen Blixen) story. The story is from a novella and concerns a wealthy Macao merchant, Mr Clay (Welles) who attempts to prove his power by making an old seaman’s legend into fact. Welles cleverly uses the original story as a basis of a philosophical inquisition. Cast includes Orson Welles, Jeanne Moreau, Roger Coggio and Norman Eshley. Music by Eric Satie.

results.title: The Immortal battalion = The Way ahead
results.creator_credit: G C F, Two Cities Films, Norman Walker, John Sutro and Carol Reed
results.brief_description: Beginning as a British Army training film called “The New lot”, this film was then expanded into a feature length film written by Eric Ambler and Peter Ustinov, entitled “The Way ahead” for its British audience and re-edited into a slightly shorter film entitled “The Immortal battalion” for an American audience. Its basic concept is as a recruiting and training film for the British Army mixing training and combat footage with filmed sequences. The storyline is about a bunch of raw recruits from a variety of backgrounds who are finally welded into a unified and disciplined regimental unit ready for battle. Stars David Niven, Stanley Holloway, Peter Ustinov, Trevor Howard.

results.title: The Immigrant experience: the long long journey
results.creator_credit: Omaha-Orange Films, Linda Gottlieb and Joan Micklin Silver
results.brief_description: Focuses on the problems and dreams of new immigrants in America by telling about an uprooted Polish family. Shows how they lived at the beginning of the 20th century and includes interviews with the grandfather today as he reveals his contentment with improved opportunities for his grandchildren.
